title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4036.2 - No one to touch horse, equipment before weighing in
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4036.2 - No one to touch horse, equipment before weighing in

State Regulations

Except by special permission of the official in charge, every jockey must upon pulling up unsaddle his or her own horse, and no
attendant shall touch the horse, except by such horse's bridle. Upon the
returning of a jockey to the winner's circle to dismount after a race has been
run, no one may touch the equipment of the jockey until he or she has been
weighed in, except upon the approval of the official in
charge. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4036.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
